H0.text: Plant hormones are chemical signals in plants that control different processes.

H1.text: Producing hormones is the chemical signal in plants that controls different processes.

H2.text: Nitrogen hormones are the chemical signals in plants that control different processes.

H3.text: Human Hormones are chemical signals in plants that control different processes.

A4.text: Plant hormones control all aspects of plant growth and development, including embryogenesis, the regulation of organ size, pathogen defense, stress tolerance and reproductive development.

A5.text: Plant hormones (or phytohormones) are signal molecules, produced within plants, that occur in extremely low concentrations.
